ranked_diseases.explanation: This syndrome is characterized by global developmental delay, compulsive behaviors, anxiety, and microcephaly, which are all present in the patient. Short stature is also commonly observed.
Cohen Syndrome often presents with microcephaly, developmental delay, and short stature. Although compulsive behaviors and anxiety are less commonly reported, they can occur.
Noonan Syndrome is associated with short stature and developmental delay. Microcephaly can be present, but compulsive behaviors and anxiety are less typical.
Angelman Syndrome includes developmental delay, microcephaly, and anxiety. Short stature and compulsive behaviors are less common but possible.
Prader-Willi Syndrome features include short stature, developmental delay, and compulsive behaviors. Microcephaly and anxiety are less frequently observed.
